item.description:
Final meeting on Schopenhauer for this round. The text is the appendix of the World as Will and Representation Volume 1. It's title is: Criticism of the Kantian Philosophy.

A reminder that according to our near future plan we will continue with reading texts related to the American and French revolutions and upheavals.
The first texts selected for that series, for the following meeting are:
Reflections on the Revolution in France by Edmund Burke (http://www.constituti...) and
The Rights of Man by Thomas Paine (http://www.ushistory.... ).

ATTENTION:
This time we plan to meet in Shabu.Ya next door to Bombay Club, if you do not find us in Shabu.Ya by 7:15pm please look for us in the Bombay Club.
item.how_to_find_us: Ask for the philosophy group from the staff.
item.name: Schopenhauer: The World as Will and Representation VI
